poems.title: Lovebirds
poems.content:
The forest shines and shows its green
It's steam, the leaves, their sheen is seen
A thousand stories wrapped in time
with rays of light that bugs do climb

Above and under, fauna moves
With rhythm, oozing lots of groove
Two lovebirds hold and watch the sight
Their love glows white with hours of flight

"A friend for life, at last", he sighed
She met his gaze with big round eyes
A wing outstretched, a gentle pet
creates vignettes of love duet

The tree can feel their warmth, their song
She'll see the world, he'll come along
The creatures, mangos, eggs they'll see
With sights in mind, they'll leave the tree

Before they go and take off flight
He sings a song and holds her tight.

poems.title: The Mango
poems.content:
For weeks they wait, a girl and boy
She waters, tends with glee
At last, it's free and green with joy
A mango from that tree!

poems.title: Coffee
poems.content:
Heat and the beans and the water is joined
Coming together in joint is the point
Black or with milk or as sweet as a fruit
Make it just right and a friend is with you

poems.title: The Octopus Project
poems.content:
This octopus tells me
a lot about you
that you care for justice
in all that you do

This octopus sings
of a better mankind
Together you'll leave
all the troubles behind.

poems.title: Surprises
poems.content:
Surprise! A gift! From me to go.
It's here so take a look
A craft? A painting? Close! But no!
A poem for your book.

poems.title: The Moon Maiden's Song
poems.author: Ernest Dowson
content: Sleep! Yet thy days are mine;
Far though my ways from thine,

poems.title: The Old Pond
poems.content:
An old silent pond

A frog jumps into the pond—

Splash! Silence again.
poems.author: Matsuo Bashō
